name: ISP-N “Ahab” Grapple/Tether Line
description: “You ever get the feeling nobody at IPS-N spends any time thinking about the names they give to things? Like, either I don’t read, so I don’t get the reference, or I do and I realize they named a survival tool after a dude who’s famous exclusively for getting dragged to his death tied to a whale.”

actions.name: Activate
actions.detail: You may expend a charge to shoot a hook at a character, object or free space up to Line 5 away from you. You are attached to the hook by a tether, and cannot move or be moved further than five spaces away, unless you teleport, in which case the tether snaps. If the hook moves more than five spaces away, you are dragged along with it.

actions.name: Reel In
actions.detail: As a Quick Action, you can reel yourself in, flying to the hook or as close to it as possible. This movement ignores engagement and doesn’t provoke reactions.

actions.name: Detach
actions.detail: You can detach from the tether as a full action.

actions.name: Retrieve
actions.detail: You can retrieve a hook and tether that you are adjacent to as a full action, restoring a charge.

name: Scrable Grenade
description: This is actually a high-power, short-range distress beacon meant to help search-and-rescue teams locate astronauts who’ve been thrown into space. Some asshole discovered that if you jam a bunch of escape characters into the broadcast signal and overvolt the transmitter, you can make unshielded electronics shit themselves. It fries itself after a few seconds, a fate many wrenchies have wished upon its inventor.

actions.name: Scrable Grenade
actions.detail: Expend a charge for the following effect: (Range 5, Burst 1, Grenade) Affected characters without the BIOLOGICAL tag must succeed on a SYSTEMS save against 10 + your GRIT or become JAMMED until the end of their next turn.
